reviewText: while i am a real agatha christie fan,some of her works really  hit the spot in that not only is the mystery wonderful,bit the insight that she had on people and their actions.Indeed I felt this book,and the dvd, both to be a great anaysis of the human being,their actions,and how the society they keep,really mold their nature.Not to be missed by a true fan.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Hollow

reviewText: It started out to be an interesting mystery.  However, Hercule stated talking so fast in the movie I could not understand what he was saying.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Hollow

reviewText: Let me put it this way: This is the only Agatha Christie novel that makes me think I can take a similar premise and do a better job. One given -- I didn't read the original version. But this is my least favorite Poirot adaptation. This is partially due to a sex scene (characters mostly clothed, but still obvious), but I just didn't like this story. Still, the acting was at the usual standard.
summary: Good Acting, But Definitely My Least Favorite Poirot Adaptation
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Hollow

reviewText: I'm a huge fan of David Suchets portrayal of the Beligian sleuth Hercule Poirot!  This was the first feature length film of his that I had seen and I absolutely loved it.  The acting is superb, and the story interesting.  I recommend all of Mr. Suchets Poirot DVDs and certainly this one!
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Hollow

reviewText: I thought that this film deviated from my impression of the book just a little too much. Still, the story was true to the standard Poirot mystery and the cast were all quite believeable, which is frequently a problem when films are made of Christie Mysteries. This is a serious work, although one gets a feeling that the director knew quite well that he was making this one for TV and not for the Cinema. "The Hollow" has long been one of my top 10 Christie mysteries and I harbor no specific complaint of this rendering. To pinpoint my review, this film/DVD is very good and a "must buy" for anyone who is moderately a Christie enthusiast. I should also add that the cinematography is superior and a pleasure to watch.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Hollow
